standard.rule_description: For building area types included in Table G3.1.1-1, vertical fenestration areas for new buildings and additions shall equal that in Table G3.1.1-1 based on the area of gross above-grade walls that separate conditioned spaces and semiheated spaces from the exterior.

rule-67j71-d.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space that has two exterior walls with windows. rule-04o58-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space that has two exterior walls with windows. Baseline fenestration area is established correctly.

standard.rule_description: For building areas not shown in Table G3.1.1-1, vertical fenestration areas for new buildings and additions shall equal that in the proposed design or 40% of gross above-grade wall area, whichever is smaller.

rule-04o58-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space that has two exterior walls with windows. rule-04o58-c.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space that has two exterior walls with windows. The building segment includes existing components and the building area type is not included in Table G3.1.1-1. The outcome cannot be determined.
rule-04o58-c.expected_raised_message_includes: Building is not all new and baseline WWR matches values prescribed in Table G3.1.1-1. However, the fenestration area prescribed in Table G3.1.1-1 does not apply to the existing envelope per TABLE G3.1 baseline column #5 (c). For existing Envelope, the baseline fenestration area must equal the existing fenestration area prior to the proposed work. A manual check is required to verify compliance.

standard.rule_description: For building areas not shown in Table G3.1.1-1, vertical fenestration areas for new buildings and additions shall equal that in the proposed design or 40% of gross above-grade wall area, whichever is smaller.

rule-80o45-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Vertical fenestration area in the baseline model is distributed on each face in the same proportion as in the proposed design.

standard.rule_description: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design

rule-80o45-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a zone that has two exterior walls with windows. Vertical fenestration area in the baseline model is not distributed on each face in the same proportion as in the proposed design.
rule-80o45-b.expected_raised_message_includes: The vertical fenestration is not distributed across baseline opaque surfaces in the same proportion as in the proposed design. Verify if envelope is existing or altered and can be excluded from this check.

standard.rule_description: The vertical fenestration shall be distributed on each face of the building in the same proportion as in the proposed design

rule-87g56-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes an existing space. Existing fenestration area cannot be determined.

The baseline vertical fenestration area for a existing zone must equal to the fenestration area prior to the proposed scope of work. The baseline fenestration area in zone must be checked manually.

standard.rule_description: The baseline fenestration area for an existing building shall equal the existing fenestration area prior to the proposed work

rule-87g56-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes an altered space. Existing fenestration area prior to proposed work cannot be determined.

rule-87g56-c.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space that is new construction. There is no existing fenestration.

rule-82y74-a.test_description: Project located in climate zone 4A has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface and a skylight. The space has non-residential occupancy type and is conditioned based on heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves it. The skylight uses manually controlled dynamic shading, and the average SHGC and VT cannot be determined.
rule-82y74-a.expected_raised_message_includes: SUBSURFACE INCLUDES MANUALLY CONTROLLED DYNAMIC GLAZING IN THE PROPOSED DESIGN. VERIFY THAT SHGC AND VT WERE MODELED AS THE AVERAGE OF THE MINIMUM AND MAXIMUM SHGC AND VT.

rule-78j13-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces one of which has skylights. Skylight area in the proposed design is less than 3% of total roof area. Baseline skylight area is correctly modeled as equal to the skylight area in the proposed design.

standard.rule_description: If skylight area in the proposed desing is 3% or less of the roof surface, the skylight area shall be equal to that in the proposed design.

rule-78j13-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces one of which has skylights. Skylight area in the proposed design is less than 3% of the total roof area. Baseline skylight area is not equal to the  skylight area in the proposed desiging, which is incorrect.

standard.rule_description: If skylight area in the proposed desing is 3% or less of the roof surface, the skylight area shall be equal to that in the proposed design.

rule-84u02-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces one of which has skylights. Skylight area in the proposed design is greater than 3% of the total roof area. Baseline skylight area ratio reduced to 3%.

standard.rule_description: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.

rule-84u02-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a conditioned zone that has two roof surfaces one of which has skylights. Skylight area in the proposed design is greater than 3% of the total roof area. Baseline skylight area ratio is higher than 3%.

standard.rule_description: If the skylight area of the proposed design is greater than 3%, baseline skylight area shall be decreased by an identical percentage in all roof components in which skylights are located to reach 3%.

standard.rule_description: Skylight area must be allocated to surfaces in the same proportion in the baseline as in the proposed design; Skylight orientation and tilt shall be the same as in the proposed design.

rule-18s99-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface thermal emittance in the proposed and user models is equal to 0.9

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same thermal emittance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.9 default emittance.

rule-18s99-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface thermal emittance in the proposed and user models is equal to 0.7
rule-18s99-b.expected_raised_message_includes: matches that in the user model but is not equal to the prescribed default value of 0.9. Verify that the modeled value is based on testing in accordance with section 5.5.3.1.1(a).

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same thermal emittance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.9 default emittance.

rule-18s99-c.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface thermal emittance in the proposed model is equal to 0.9, but the roof surface thermal emittance in the user model is equal to 0.7.
rule-18s99-c.expected_raised_message_includes: Fail if the thermal emittance in the user model is based on aged test data. roof thermal emittance is equal to the prescribed default value of 0.9 but differs from the thermal emittance in the user model

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same thermal emittance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.9 default emittance.

rule-18s99-d.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface thermal emittance in the proposed model is equal to 0.5, but the roof surface thermal emittance in the user model is equal to 0.7.

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same thermal emittance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.9 default emittance.

rule-48w84-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The baseline roof emittance is correctly set to 0.9

standard.rule_description: The baseline roof surfaces shall be modeled using a solar reflectance of 0.30.

rule-48w84-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The baseline roof emittance is incorrectly set to 0.5

standard.rule_description: The baseline roof surfaces shall be modeled using a solar reflectance of 0.30.

rule-78r30-a.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface solar reflectance in the proposed and user models is equal to 0.3

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same solar reflectance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.7 default reflectance.

rule-78r30-b.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface solar reflectance in the proposed and user models is equal to 0.7
rule-78r30-b.expected_raised_message_includes: matches that in the user model but is not equal to the prescribed default value of 0.3. Verify that reflectance was established using aged test data as required in section 5.5.3.1(a).

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same solar reflectance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.7 default reflectance.

rule-78r30-c.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface solar reflectance in the proposed model is equal to 0.3, but the roof surface thermal emittance in the user model is equal to 0.7.
rule-78r30-c.expected_raised_message_includes: Fail if the thermal emittance in the user model is based on aged test data. roof surface solar reflectance is equal to the prescribed default value of 0.3 but differs from the solar reflectance in the user model

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same solar reflectance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.7 default reflectance.

rule-78r30-d.test_description: Project has one building segment and includes a space with a roof surface. The roof surface solar reflectance in the proposed model is equal to 0.5, but the roof surface thermal emittance in the user model is equal to 0.7.

standard.rule_description: The proposed roof surfaces shall be modeled using the same solar reflectance as in the user model if the aged test data are available, or equal to 0.7 default reflectance.

rule-45p36-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one zone. Infiltration has been specified for the zone. weather-driven infiltration modeling method is used

standard.rule_description: The infiltration modeling method in the baseline includes adjustment for weather and building operation.

rule-45p36-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one zone. Infiltration has been specified for the zone. Pressure-based infiltration modeling method is used

standard.rule_description: The infiltration modeling method in the baseline includes adjustment for weather and building operation.

rule-45p36-c.test_description: Project has one building segment with one zone. Infiltration has been specified for the zone. Constant infiltration modeling method is used

standard.rule_description: The infiltration modeling method in the baseline includes adjustment for weather and building operation.

rule-69u47-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one zone. Infiltration has been specified for the zone. The proposed infiltration modeling method is the same as the baseline infiltration modeling method

standard.rule_description: The infiltration modeling method in the proposed includes adjustment for weather and building operation.

rule-69u47-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one zone. Infiltration has been specified for the zone. The proposed infiltration modeling method is the same as the baseline infiltration modeling method

standard.rule_description: The infiltration modeling method in the proposed includes adjustment for weather and building operation.

rule-39k65-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes two surfaces - one adjacent to exterior and another adjacent to ground. The space is conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The baseline infiltration flow rate @75PA is established correctly.

standard.rule_description: The baseline air leakage rate of the building envelope (I75Pa) at a fixed building pressure differential of 0.3 in. of water shall be 1 cfm/ft2.  The air leakage rate of the building envelope shall be converted to appropriate units for the simulation program using one of the methods in Section Table G3.1.1.4.

rule-23m90-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes an exterior wall surface. The space is unconditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. Air leakage rate at wind pressure in unenclosed and unconditioned spaces is the same in the proposed design as in the user model

standard.rule_description: The air leakage rate in unconditioned and unenclosed spaces must be the same in the baseline and proposed design.

rule-23m90-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes an exterior wall surface. The space is unconditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. Air leakage rate at wind pressure in unenclosed and unconditioned spaces is not the same in the proposed design as in the user model

standard.rule_description: The air leakage rate in unconditioned and unenclosed spaces must be the same in the baseline and proposed design.

rule-67a77-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes a roof surface with a skylight subsurface. The space is conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The proposed infiltration flow rate at wind pressure is established correctly based on default 0.6 cfm/ft2  @75PA.

standard.rule_description:
The proposed air leakage rate of the building envelope (I75Pa) at a fixed building pressure differential of 0.3 in. of water shall be 0.6 cfm/ft2 for buildings providing verification in accordance with Section 5.9.1.2. The air leakage rate of the building envelope shall be converted to appropriate units for the simulation program using one of the methods in Section Table G3.1.1.4. 
Exceptions: When whole-building air leakage testing, in accordance with Section 5.4.3.1.1, is specified during design and completed after construction, the proposed design air leakage rate of the building envelope shall be as measured.

rule-67a77-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes a roof surface with a skylight subsurface. The space is conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The proposed infiltration flow rate at wind pressure is not based on default 0.6 cfm/ft2  @75PA. Manual check required to verify that site measurements were performed
rule-67a77-b.expected_raised_message_includes: The building total air leakage rate is not equal to the required proposed design air leakage rate at 75Pa with a Conversion Factor of 0.112 as per section G3.1.1.4. and Measured air leakage rate is not entered for all conditioned and semi-heated zones. Verify the proposed air leakage rate is modeled correctly.

standard.rule_description:
The proposed air leakage rate of the building envelope (I75Pa) at a fixed building pressure differential of 0.3 in. of water shall be 0.6 cfm/ft2 for buildings providing verification in accordance with Section 5.9.1.2. Exceptions: When whole-building air leakage testing, in accordance with Section 5.4.3.1.1, is specified during design and completed after construction, the proposed design air leakage rate of the building envelope shall be as measured.

rule-40i28-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that does not include any floor surfaces adjacent to ground. This rule does not apply to the project.

standard.rule_description: It is acceptable to use either an annual average ground temperature or monthly average ground temperatures for calculation of heat loss through basement floors.

rule-40i28-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes floor surfaces adjacent to ground. The ruleset project description specifies a ground temperature schedule, but cannot be determined if it is representative of the project climate or if it was used in the calculation of heat loss.
rule-40i28-b.expected_raised_message_includes: It cannot be determined if the ground temperature schedule for the project is representative of the project climate.

standard.rule_description: It is acceptable to use either an annual average ground temperature or monthly average ground temperatures for calculation of heat loss through basement floors.

rule-40i28-c.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes floor surfaces adjacent to ground. The ruleset project description does not specify a ground temperature schedule.
rule-40i28-c.expected_raised_message_includes: A ground temperature schedule was not found for the project.

standard.rule_description: It is acceptable to use either an annual average ground temperature or monthly average ground temperatures for calculation of heat loss through basement floors.

rule-50m61-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes a wall surface with a nonswinging door subsurface. The space is residential and conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The baseline door u-factor is correctly established per Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8.

standard.rule_description: U-factor of the baseline door is based on Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the applicable door type (swinging or non-swinging) and envelope conditioning category.

rule-50m61-b.test_description: Project located in climate zone 8 has one building segment with 1 zones containing 2 spaces and a wall surface with a metal coiling door. The zone has mixed residential and nonresidential space types. All available options for baseline U-factor are the same, but baseline door u-factor does not align and is more conservative.
rule-50m61-b.expected_raised_message_includes: Rule evaluation fails with a conservative outcome.

standard.rule_description: U-factor of the baseline door is based on Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the applicable door type (swinging or non-swinging) and envelope conditioning category.

rule-50m61-c.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes a wall surface with a metal coiling door. The space is nonresidential and conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The baseline door u-factor does not align with either of the available options per Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8.

standard.rule_description: U-factor of the baseline door is based on Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the applicable door type (swinging or non-swinging) and envelope conditioning category.

rule-50m61-d.test_description: Project has one building segment with 1 zones containing 2 spaces and a wall surface with a metal coiling door. The zone has mixed residential and nonresidential space types and is conditioned based on the heating and cooling capacity of the HVAC system that serves the parent zone. The baseline door u-factor aligns with one of the available options per Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8, but cannot be determined if it is correct.
rule-50m61-d.expected_raised_message_includes: Prescribed u-factor requirement could not be determined. Verify the baseline door u-factor

standard.rule_description: U-factor of the baseline door is based on Tables G3.4-1 through G3.4-8 for the applicable door type (swinging or non-swinging) and envelope conditioning category.

rule-33l08-a.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes an unregulated roof surface. The baseline roof optical properties are the same as in the proposed design.

standard.rule_description: Opaque roof surfaces that are not regulated (not part of opaque building envelope) must be modeled with the same thermal emittance and solar reflectance in the baseline as in the proposed design.

rule-33l08-b.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes an unregulated roof surface. The baseline roof optical properties are the different from the proposed design.

standard.rule_description: Opaque roof surfaces that are not regulated (not part of opaque building envelope) must be modeled with the same thermal emittance and solar reflectance in the baseline as in the proposed design.

rule-33l08-c.test_description: Project has one building segment with one space that includes an unregulated roof surface. The proposed roof optical properties are not specified.

standard.rule_description: Opaque roof surfaces that are not regulated (not part of opaque building envelope) must be modeled with the same thermal emittance and solar reflectance in the baseline as in the proposed design.
